title: Flipped Learning-Based Digital Circuit Design and Applications

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of electrical engineering and binary number systems
context.additional_context: Non-real-time online classes in a digital device-provided environment, featuring a practice-oriented curriculum for professionals.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the basic components and operational principles of digital logic circuits.
Learners can design simple digital systems using HDL (Hardware Description Language).
Learners can analyze digital circuit design problems based on real-world cases and propose solutions.
Learners can verify and optimize the operation of designed circuits using simulation tools.
Learners can collaborate with peers on design projects through a Learning Management System (LMS).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
